content:
It's possible to modify the attachment pane with userChrome, to make it larger and with a background colour: 

/*  attachment pane */  .attachmentList { background-color: cyan !important; height: 200px !important; min-height: 200px !important; overflow: auto !important;}


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the numbers and colour as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

The colour of the attachment icon in the Attachments column (Table View) can be modified with this code: 

table[is="tree-view-table"] .attachmentcol-column img { stroke: crimson   !important;}
creator: sfhowes

content: This is a netaddress problem. The error you see is correct. They seem to be having a server problem. My suggestion to you is to send a notice to them about your situation, as they may not understand the extent of the issue. I know this to be true because I was made aware of this through other sources.
creator: davidsk

content: I have the same problem with Thunderbird 115.3.1 from the official debian repository. My Thunderbird runs in the Linux environment of a Chromebook with the latest stable ChromeOS version. Currently version 118.0.5993.86 (Official Build) (64-bit) I've had the problem since migrating from 102 to 115. Emails are almost impossible to delete from the trash. I have two accounts stored, both as imap. One of them is a smaller German provider and the other affected is a GMX account. However, I have had to hard shut down the Linux environment after a deletion process because Thunderbird no longer responds at all.

content: Capisco che la domanda richiede un intervento sul codice, comunque per quanto è scritto questo è e resta un sito di supporto, è scritto dappertutto. In caso andrebbero sistemate meglio tante scritte. Non è una polemica ma solo una precisazione in ambito della discussione. Ciao.
creator: cosentino1960

content:
Il sito support.mozilla.org è solo un'area di discussione a disposizione degli utenti Mozilla; Non è un servizio di supporto tecnico, che del resto sarebbe insostenibile per un programma gratuito.

Quanto alla tua domanda, lo hanno segnalato anche altri utenti. Non mi risulta esista al momento una soluzione. Potrebbe essere utile aprire una segnalazione su Bugzilla -> https://bugzilla.mozilla.org in modo che il bug possa essere identificato e corretto nelle prossime versioni.
